Dear Mr. Gonzalez:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on
6/1/2022. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, sections of the contract and
Modified Implementation Sustainability, and Exit Plan (MISEP) requirements, a written
corrective action plan is required. It should be noted that violations of any licensing rules
are also violations of the MISEP. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date
of this letter and must include the following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved; this includes identifying
behaviorally specific action steps.
o Repeat violations must include an explanation of why the previous
corrective action plan did not result in compliance.
 Individuals directly responsible for implementing the corrective action step for
each licensing statute and rule, DHHS policy or MISEP section citation, e.g.
workers, supervisors, program managers, director, etc.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
implemented and completed.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is achieved; this
includes identifying specific action steps for continuous monitoring.
 Signature of the responsible party and date.
Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, a regular certificate of inspection
license will be issued. If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan,
disciplinary action will result.

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes with the exception
of the following:
R 400.10209 Resident report
(1) A written resident report shall be completed 30 days
after admission and every 15 days thereafter for each
resident in a detention or shelter care facility.
One of three active detention case files reviewed did not have the written resident
report completed 30-days after admission. This report was written 35-days after
admission.
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an MISEP violation. Please note that there are
additional MISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1. The facility is in
compliance will all additional MISEP requirements.
3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a DHS Contract/Policy violation. Please note
that there are additional DHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be included in
section 1. The facility is not contracted, so DHS Contract/Policy requirements are not
applicable.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was did not required technical assistance.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following area:
 Development of a tracking system to cover when an employee is off so there is
no gap in services provided.
 Development of an over-site (compliance) position.
4

VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
The facility has submitted no acceptable corrective action plans during this licensing
period.
Six restraint reports were reviewed. The documentation indicated staff followed the
policy and procedures for each restraint when taking this action with a youth. There
was documentation of debriefing with the youth and efforts to avoid the restraint. Six
seclusion reports were reviewed and again, the staff followed the facility
policy/procedures when youth were placed in their rooms. There was documentation
of room checks being completed as required to ensure the safety of the youth.
Interviews were conducted with staff and youth at the facility. All of the youth report
feeling safe and well cared for. They report staff assist them and are always present.
Staff report with the change resulting from the Chief Administrator leaving, they
believe administration is more invested and aware of daily operations. They feel
supported and “heard” by the License Designee who is currently in the role of Chief
Administrator.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules and/or MISEP requirements. Upon receipt of an
acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended that the facility will be issued a
renewal of their regular license.
